Multiple web outlets covered the claims: abortion group Live Action about Planned Parenthood enforcing "abortion quotas" and rewarding employees for promoting abortion services.
The claims originated from a video clip: featuring an interview between Lila Rose and a former Planned Parenthood worker named Sue Thayer, who discussed the alleged "abortion quotas" and rewards.
Another former Planned Parenthood employ: providing additional support for the claims.
Sue Thayer: the former employee interviewed in the video, had a 17-year employment history with Planned Parenthood and maintained anti-abortion views throughout her tenure. She also led a failed effort to prosecute the organization in 2011, alleging Medicaid fraud related to the dispensing of birth control pills.
